# setContentsRectNeedsUpdate()

**Instance Method**

Informs the view that contains the image when the layout changes and the view needs to reload its content.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor final func setContentsRectNeedsUpdate()
```

## Discussion

The framework ignores calls to this method when your app adds the interaction to a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/UIKit/UIImageView], which calculates the [doc://com.apple.VisionKit/documentation/VisionKit/ImageAnalysisInteraction/contentsRect] based on the image view’s [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/UIKit/UIView/ContentMode-swift.enum].

When the view that contains the image isn’t an instance of [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/UIKit/UIImageView], call this method when the layout changes. The interaction then invokes the delegate’s [doc://com.apple.VisionKit/documentation/VisionKit/ImageAnalysisInteractionDelegate/contentsRect(for:)] callback, which provides the updated content area to the system.

## Managing custom image views

- **contentsRect**: A rectangle, in unit coordinate space, that describes the content area of the interaction.
